intro: Capanea quitensis, commonly known as the Peruvian capanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or arid soils, and is adapted to the harsh conditions of the Andes. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Capanea quitensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
